Which of the following examples would result in consumers paying for the largest burden of an excise tax placed on a producer? A. If the demand curve is price elastic and the supply curve is price inelastic, B. If the demand curve is price elastic and the supply curve is perfectly elastic, C. If the demand curve is price inelastic and the supply curve is price elastic, D. If the demand curve is perfectly inelastic and the supply curve is price elastic

The correct answer: C. If the demand curve is price inelastic and the supply curve is price elastic

A price inelastic demand curve means consumers are not very responsive to price changes, so they will continue to buy the good even with a tax increase.  A price elastic supply curve means producers are very responsive to price changes, so they will absorb less of the tax burden.

A whiffle ball is tossed straight up, reaches a highest point, and falls back down. Air resistance is not negligible. Which of the following statements are true?
I. The ball’s speed is zero at the highest point.
II. The ball’s acceleration is zero at the highest point.
III. The ball takes a longer time to travel up to the highest point than to fall back down. A. I only, B. II only, C. I & II only, D. I & III only

The correct answer: D. I & III only

Statement I is true because at the highest point, the ball momentarily stops before changing direction.  Statement II is false because gravity is always acting on the ball, causing a downward acceleration. Statement III is true because air resistance acts against the ball's motion, slowing it down more on the way up than on the way down.
